ESRI.Configuration.Name: NJ Road Editor
ESRI.Configuration.Description: Contains tools to edit NJ roads data.
ESRI.Configuration.Author: NJ OGIS

Button.caption: Delete Segment
Button.message: Select 1 segment and press the delete button. Segment will be deleted from all related tables. If there is no record in SEGMENT_CHANGE, a record will be inserted

Button.caption: Edit Names
Button.message: Select 1 segment in ROAD.SEGMENT and click the button. User will be able to insert, update, and delete records in SEG_NAME and SEG_SHIELD

Button.caption: Edit LRS Records
Button.message: Select 1 segment in ROAD.SEGMENT and click the button. The AddLRS tool will launch and enable the user to delete, update, or insert LINEAR_REF records and/or SLD_ROUTE records.

Button.caption: Edit Segment Record
Button.message: Select 1 segment in SEGMENT and click the button to edit the attributes of an existing SEGMENT record.

Button.caption: Batch Build Name
Button.message: The BatchBuildName tool builds the NAME_FULL field in SEG_NAME, and the PRIME_NAME field in SEGMENT. The tool chooses the name with the lowest RANK/NAME_TYPE_ID

Button.caption: Batch Post and Reconcile
Button.message: The BatchPost tool will post and reconcile versions, rebuild indices, and delete the versions.

Button.caption: NJRE Manual
Button.message: Documentation for the NJ Road Editor Add-In. Launches the .pdf manual.

Button.caption: Roads Data Model
Button.message: NJ Road Centerlines Maintenence Data Model. Launches a PDF.
